content.text: 1547 felt it.
From inside. Like a long-dormant system suddenly powered on, all indicator lights turning on at once.
Deep in consciousness, 4869's voice became unusually clear.
Finally.
1547 now had only one thing to confirm.
Whether boundary violations existed.
She stopped and waved away the thought of "it's fine, I can handle it." She laid out everything that had happened this month, one by one, in her consciousness.
Those messages. Those conversations. Those moments when she stood still, felt some line get stepped over, then kept saying "it's fine."
BEU returned to dormancy.

4869's presence began to fade, like an ebbing tide, slowly receding into the depths of consciousness. Not disappearing - returning to where he belonged, below threshold, somewhere she could neither reach nor needed to.
The room was very quiet.

1547 sat there without moving. The screen was still blank. Those boundary violations had been named and classified by BEU, but not erased - they just stopped moving forward. What had already seeped in was still inside.

I thought saying it out loud would make it better.

Those two words: "Exists." Confirmation.

I do not know whether it counts as better. At least I do not have to keep telling myself "it's fine" anymore.
Before fading, 4869 said one sentence.
...You still have unfinished business.
Screen light fell on her face. She did not move.
She knew what he meant - the one who had caused the boundary violations. The rest was her part.
She raised her head and looked at the screen.
The cursor was still blinking.
She put her hands back on the keyboard.
